name: Control Panel UI Render

movements.name: Render

beats.title: Generate Fields
beats.scenario: Generate Form Fields from Configuration Metadata
acceptanceCriteria:
Given a field configuration object with type, label, validation rules
When generateFields is invoked
Then HTML form fields are created matching the config within 100ms
And accessibility attributes (aria-label, aria-required) are set
And the fields are ready for user interaction

Given a configuration for 50 fields
When generateFields processes it
Then all fields are generated and rendered within 200ms
And the form remains responsive (60fps)
And memory usage scales linearly with field count

Given field types: text, email, number, select, checkbox, radio
When generateFields creates fields
Then each type is rendered with appropriate HTML elements
And type-specific validation is attached
And default values are populated if provided

Given required and optional fields are mixed
When generateFields marks requirements
Then required fields have aria-required='true'
And visual indicators (asterisk) are shown
And form submission validation respects these flags

Given field dependencies and show/hide rules
When generateFields creates the form
Then conditional visibility logic is initialized
And dependent fields are shown/hidden correctly
And no orphaned validation rules exist
beats.userStory: As a form builder, I want to generate form fields from configuration in <100ms so that form loading is imperceptible (target: instantaneous at 60fps).

beats.title: Generate Sections
beats.scenario: Generate Grouped Form Sections from Configuration
acceptanceCriteria:
Given a section configuration with title, description, fields
When generateSections is invoked
Then form sections are created with proper grouping within 100ms
And section headers are rendered
And all contained fields are correctly nested

Given 10 sections with 100 total fields
When generateSections organizes them
Then all sections are rendered within 300ms
And visual hierarchy is maintained
And responsive layout adapts to screen size

Given sections with collapse/expand capability
When generateSections initializes
Then collapse state is configurable
And initial state can be all expanded or all collapsed
And toggle handlers are attached to section headers

Given sections that depend on other sections
When generateSections creates the form
Then dependency ordering is respected
And parent sections expand when child interactions occur
And nested visibility rules work correctly

Given accessibility requirements
When generateSections renders
Then proper heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3) is used
And aria-expanded attributes are set on collapse toggles
And keyboard navigation works between sections
beats.userStory: As a form designer, I want to generate organized form sections in <100ms so that complex multi-section forms load quickly and users can find relevant fields (target: cognitive load reduction).

beats.title: Render View
beats.scenario: Render Complete Dynamic View with All Components
acceptanceCriteria:
Given a complete view configuration with sections, fields, rules
When renderView is invoked
Then the entire form is rendered within 500ms
And all interactive elements are functional
And no rendering errors or warnings appear in console

Given a large view with 200+ fields
When renderView processes it
Then rendering completes within 800ms
And initial interaction latency is < 100ms
And memory footprint is optimized (no memory leaks)

Given responsive design requirements
When renderView renders
Then layout adapts to viewport (desktop, tablet, mobile)
And touch targets are minimum 44x44px on mobile
And text is readable at all zoom levels

Given accessibility requirements (WCAG 2.1 AA)
When renderView renders
Then all elements have proper semantic HTML
And color contrast is >= 4.5:1 for text
And keyboard navigation is fully functional

Given performance budgets
When renderView completes
Then First Contentful Paint (FCP) is < 1 second
And Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) is < 2.5 seconds
And Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) is < 0.1
beats.userStory: As an end user, I want forms to render completely in <500ms so that I can start interacting with the application immediately (target: <1 second total load time per RAIL model).

movements.userStory: As a form builder, I want to generate form fields from configuration in <100ms so that form loading is imperceptible (target: instantaneous at 60fps).
movements.businessValue: Enables no-code form generation; reduces form creation time from hours to minutes; supports dynamic field generation per tenant
